concept.title: Time Import Types
concept.shortdesc: Several import types are available: Pay Types, Persona Batch Assignment, Punches, Punch Pairs, Shifts, Shift Patterns, Time Codes, and Timesheet Edits. Each import defines a set of required columns and supports optional ones.

conbody.p: Field values are matched to the position of the column name as each row is processed. In addition, any custom labor metrics defined in Time can be added as a column to the time imports. The column name should be the labor metric name used in the Time feature.

All columns are required so that they appear in the header of the file, which ensures a successful import. However, filling in information for all of the columns is not required. Columns with optional input are identified in the following sections.

section.title: Setup Information Imports
section.p: Several imports are available for activating the Time feature: Pay Types, Persona Batch Assignment, Shifts, Shift Patterns, and Time Codes.

row.entry: Identifies if the time is paid or unpaid.
Beginning date the pay type can be used in a calculation.
End date the pay type can be used in a calculation.

section.title: Persona Batch Assignment
section.p: Input for the following columns is optional: StartDate, EndDate, TimeCode, ShiftPattern, ShiftPatternStartDay, PayRuleGroup, TimesheetEditRights, LaborMetricGroup, TimesheetConfigurationGroup, MealWaiver, BreakWaiver, RoleAssignment, TouchBaseGroup, TimesheetApprovalNotification, TimesheetModificationNotification, TimesheetRejectionNotification, TimesheetSubmissionNotification, RetroTimesheetApprovalNotification, RetroTimesheetModificationNotification, RetroTimesheetRejectionNotification, RetroTimesheetApprovalNotification, and RetroTimesheetSubmissionNotification.

row.entry: Number of minutes past midnight that the shift begins.
Number of minutes past midnight that the shift ends.
Number of days in the rotation.
Day of the rotation that you want to assign the shift to.
Name of shift. Separate column for each shift.
WRK, MEAL, BREAK, HOLPD, or SICKP
Work, Meal, Break, Holiday, or Sick
Default pay type when the time code is used.
This identifies the type of data the time code will store.
Required if data type is Time
Description field of the unit for display on the timesheet
Required if data type is Numeric
Number of decimal places to display for Numeric type.
Required if data type is Numeric
Currency format for timesheet entry and display.
Required if data type is Currency
Beginning date the time code can be used.
Ending date the time code can be used.

section.title: Timesheet Information Imports
section.p: Several imports are available for timesheet information: Punches, Punch Pairs, and Timesheet Edits.

row.entry: Time of the punch in ISO 8601 format. If no offset information is specified, the employeeâ€™s time zone is used.

section.p: Input for the following columns is optional: Latitude, Longitude, TIME_CODE, JOB, LOCATION, PROJECT, SHIFT, ORGLVL1, ORGLVL2, ORGLVL3, and ORGLVL4.

section.title: Punch Pairs

row.entry: Timesheet date to apply punches to.
Time of the In punch in ISO 8601 format. If no offset information is specified, the employeeâ€™s time zone is used.
Time of the Out punch in ISO 8601 format. If no offset information is specified, the employeeâ€™s time zone is used.

section.p: Input for the following columns is optional: TIME_CODE (value is applied to the In punch), JOB, LOCATION, PROJECT, SHIFT, ORGLVL1, ORGLVL2, ORGLVL3, and ORGLVL4.

section.title: Timesheet Edits

row.entry: Timesheet date to apply the edits to.
One of four options: HOURLY_TIME_EDIT, DURATION_EDIT, CURRENCY_EDIT, or NUMERIC_EDIT
Time of the In punch in ISO 8601 format. If no offset information is specified, the employeeâ€™s time zone is used.
Yes (when HOURLY_TIME_EDIT is specified â€“ ignored otherwise)
Time of the Out punch in ISO 8601 format. If no offset information is specified, the employeeâ€™s time zone is used.
Yes (when HOURLY_TIME_EDIT is specified â€“ ignored otherwise)
Yes (when DURATION_EDIT is specified â€“ ignored otherwise)
Yes (when DURATION_EDIT is specified â€“ ignored otherwise)
Yes (when DURATION_EDIT is specified â€“ ignored otherwise)
Time code to apply to the edit.
Pay type to apply to the edit. This defaults to the time codeâ€™s pay type if not specified.

section.p: Input for the following columns is optional: JOB, LOCATION, PROJECT, SHIFT, ORGLVL1, ORGLVL2, ORGLVL3, and ORGLVL4.
